body.p: Twenty-third governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky. Cumberland County, Kentucky, native. Married Sallie Travis Bramlette in September 1837. Father of James T. Bramlette, William L. Bramlette, Eugene Bramlette, and Corrina Bell Bramlette. Practiced law in Clinton County, Kentucky, and Columbia, Kentucky. Represented Cumberland and Clinton Counties in the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1841 to 1843. Served as commonwealth's attorney of the Eighth Judicial District of Kentucky from 1848 to 1850. Served as circuit judge of the Sixth Judicial District of Kentucky from 1856 to 1861. Served as colonel of the 3rd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment, U. S. A., from 1861 to 1862. Served as district attorney of the United States District Court for Kentucky in 1863. Elected governor of Kentucky in November 1863. Served as governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from September 1, 1863, to September 3, 1867. Owned law firm of Bramlette & Van Winkle in partnership with Ephraim L. Van Winkle. Owned two enslaved persons in 1850. Owned nine enslaved persons in 1860.
